001package imagingbook.lib.util.bits;
002
003/**
004 * This interface defines the behavior of bit vectors, i.e.,
005 * fixed-sized vectors with single bit elements.
006 * This is similar to the standard Java class {@link java.util.BitSet}, which
007 * implements variable-sized vectors and additional functionality.
008 * 
009 * @author WB
010 */
011public interface BitVector {
012        
013        /**
014         * Returns {@code true} is the specified bit-element is set (1),
015         * {@code false} otherwise (0).
016         * @param i the element index
017         * @return as described
018         */
019        public boolean get(int i);
020        
021        /**
022         * Sets the specified bit-element to the given boolean value
023         * (1 for {@code true}, 0 for {@code false}).
024         * @param i the element index
025         * @param val a boolean value
026         */
027        public default void set(int i, boolean val) {
028                if (val) 
029                        this.set(i);
030                else
031                        this.unset(i);
032        }
033        
034        /**
035         * Sets the specified element (to bit-value 1).
036         * @param i the element index
037         */
038        public void set(int i);
039        
040        /**
041         * Unsets the specified element (to bit-value 0).
042         * @param i the element index
043         */
044        public void unset(int i);
045        
046        /**
047         * Sets all element values to 1.
048         */
049        public void setAll();
050        
051        /**
052         * Sets all element values to 0.
053         */
054        public void unsetAll();
055        
056        /**
057         * Returns the length of this bit vector.
058         * @return the length of this bit vector
059         */
060        public int getLength();
061        
062        /**
063         * Returns the contents of this bit vector as a {@code byte} array.
064         * Bit-value 0 maps to byte value 0x00, value 1 maps to 0xFF.
065         * @return a {@code byte} array
066         */
067        public default byte[] toByteArray() {
068                byte[] bytes = new byte[this.getLength()];
069                for (int i = 0; i < bytes.length; i++) {
070                        if (get(i)) {
071                                bytes[i] = (byte) 0xFF;
072                        }
073                }
074                return bytes;
075        }
076        
077        /**
078         * Returns the contents of this bit vector as a {@code boolean} array.
079         * Bit-value 0 maps to false, value 1 maps to true.
080         * @return a {@code boolean} array
081         */
082        public default boolean[] toBooleanArray() {
083                boolean[] bools = new boolean[this.getLength()];
084                for (int i = 0; i < bools.length; i++) {
085                        bools[i] = get(i);
086                }
087                return bools;
088        }
089        
090        // static factory methods -----------------------------------------------
091        
092        /**
093         * Creates and returns a new bitvector of type
094         * {@link BitVector64} from the specified {@code byte}
095         * array. Each byte element b is interpreted as 0/false
096         * if b = 0 and 1/true otherwise.
097         * 
098         * @param bytes an array of byte values
099         * @return a new bit vector
100         */
101        public static BitVector from(byte[] bytes) {
102                return new BitVector64(bytes);
103        }
104        
105        /**
106         * Creates and returns a new bitvector of type
107         * {@link BitVector64} from the specified {@code boolean}
108         * array, setting elements to 0/false or 1/true.
109         * 
110         * @param bools an array of boolean values
111         * @return a new bit vector
112         */
113        public static BitVector from(boolean[] bools) {
114                return new BitVector64(bools);
115        }
116        
117        /**
118         * Creates and returns a new bitvector of type
119         * {@link BitVector64} with the specified length.
120         * Elements are initialized to 0/false.
121         * 
122         * @param length the length of the bit vector
123         * @return a new bit vector
124         */
125        public static BitVector create(int length) {
126                return new BitVector64(length);
127        }
128
129}
